abstract: Exhibit From Portraits to Tweets: Imagery, Technology and the U.S. Presidency, at the Hofstra University Museum in Hempstead, explores effects of changing technology on public perception of American presidents (Metropolitan/Long Island).
lead_paragraph: “From Portraits to Tweets: Imagery, Technology and the U.S. Presidency,” at the Hofstra University Museum, explores how changing technology has affected the public perception of American presidents — and how presidents and their handlers have tried to use the media to manipulate that perception.

headline.main: The Changing Imagery of U.S. Presidents: ‘From Portraits to Tweets’ Is On View in Hempstead
